news_header: Donald Trump sought Japanese investment in the 90s during financial struggles, influenced by his experiences in the 80s, leading to his fixation on tariffs as a means to address trade imbalances.
news_original_title: How Japan sparked Trump's 40-year love affair with tariffs
news_text: In the 1990s, Donald Trump faced financial difficulties and turned to Japan for investment, influenced by his earlier observations of Japanese economic success in the 80s. His resentment towards Japan's perceived advantage in trade and military support shaped his views on tariffs, which he has consistently advocated as a tool to pressure foreign nations into fairer trade practices. Despite evolving global dynamics, Trump's belief in tariffs remains a cornerstone of his economic philosophy, reflecting a transactional approach to international commerce.
